text: We came to Vegas for the weekend. We were craving some Mexican food and I decided to yelp it. We saw that this place had 5 stars and 1 dollar sign, and being the cheapos that we are, we decided to check it out. It was great. The sopes were hand made and fresh. They made the dough right then and there. They were so good. I would recommend this to everyone. It's a pretty casual place with great taste! We would definitely be coming back.

Food was amazing.  My wife is super picky about Mexican food, and she loved their food.  The place is very clean and well kept, and the waitress provided superior service with great communication skills.  The restaurant is tucked away, so it's difficult to find.  However, if you follow their address and unit number, you can find it.  I highly recommend this authentic Mexican restaurant!

Food, especially the Mariscos was delicious. I recommend getting the talapia, or shrimp. Amazing service - staff and cook even came out to greet us and was very attentive.  Location might be hard to find, as the same shopping center has two different sides.

I had a flight to catch back to NYC.  I wanted a plate of enchiladas, refried beans and rice.
PP did not disappoint.  They made us chicken enchiladas with a tangy green sauce, and sour cream- Suizas.  Just what I wanted and just thinking about it, I wish I could have it again right now.  Excellent service, open kitchen, clean.  Owner/chef came out to talk to us.

Came to try it this place out of curiosity. Turns out the place is damn good. I got the Cubana Mexicana torta.  It's was huge and full of flavor. It did not disappoint. The aguas frescas are good as well. I would recommend this place if you're looking to trying out a new Mexican restaurant.

Delicious!! Wanted to try something off the beaten path (strip) and found this place. The menu is in Spanish so we needed a little help. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Food was authentic and delicious! Would def return
Excellent fish, beans, salsa and guacamole - over all excellent food. However twice as expensive as any Bay Area equivalent.

I have been coming here since when I was a kid back when their first location was in waterman in San Bernardino and then in Colton. Flash forward now, stopped by on edc weekend and was treated like family, the food is great and delicious, the campechanas are the best, it's like the whole sea in a bowl. Best of luck with your new location, I will keep supporting when I'm in visiting Vegas and back home in california.

I was expecting more based on the positive Yelp reviews. We were visiting Vegas and we're  running an errand in the area. The food was good, service was fair. The waitress was unfamiliar with things on the menu and had a hard time explaining food when asked.

I wouldn't make the effort to eat here again.

I saw an ad online with a picture of the cubana Mexicana torta and had to go in and try it. It was a HUGE mistake. Luckily I got some tacos to go with it and they were pretty good, but not good enough to go back for.
Had excellent fish tacos and a quesadilla de rajas. The waitress Mayra was super friendly and helpful. A nice authentic Mexican restaurant away from the strip.

First off I am from Colton CA, and they have a location near me that is my go to spot for michalada's and great food every time! So I came to Vegas to get married and naturally I wanted good Mexican food, so we came to papagyos here and OMG the food was so good better then the one at home!! I had menudo and my my husband had the shrimp with hand made tortillas!!! I could have ate like 4 more bowls of that menudo and the shrimp was nice and spicy. The staff is attentive and very friendly and the cook has passion you can definitely taste in the food, I have had everything on the menu at home so I'm positive anything you try would be great here!! If you are in Vegas and want great authentic Mexican food at a great price I would head here for sure really worth checking out. FYI we stayed at Excalibur and it was 4.9 miles away took us less then 10 minutes to get there.

Amazing Ceviche!! Tastes like ceviche should. Succulent shrimp cured in lime juice. Carne asada was authentic without being over salted or spiced. Beans were "real" and not out of a can. Everything was incredible from salsa to Mexican Coke!

Excellent authentic Mexican food and very reasonably priced. We got the Tierra y Mar fajitas and chile colorado burrito. Both were large portions and very tasty. Will definitely come back the next time we're in Vegas. It was with the $10 Lyft ride from the strip.

Stopped here yesterday for a late lunch.  Having read other Yelp reviews, I decided to try the Torta Cubana.  The reviews don't lie - this sandwich must weigh close to two pounds and I couldn't open up my mouth wide enough to take a full bite.  I've got to say it was very tasty, though.  I somehow ate half of the sandwich and immediately went home and napped up.

I asked the waitress if anyone had eaten an entire sandwich.  She said a tall, skinny man ate an entire Torta Cubana and a couple of enchiladas.  Color me skeptical.

A very nice man who I believe to be the owner came out to chat.  He suggested I come back and try some other items on the menu, many of which are Southern Mexican specialties.  Gonna take him up on that!

I also had a Michelada, which was on point.
Very good shrimp  cocktail and fish tacos, great price.great location. Lot in the menu
Great place! Food really "mexican" and awesome service, really looking forward to come back. Agua de horchata tastes even better than in some places in Mexico...

So excited to have found this place!!! Its a bit hidden but as soon as you walk in the door, great good, and great service by Maura welcomes you!!! You can taste the cleanliness and great quality ingredients used to prepare food.  Chef Alberto takes pride in his cooking and has the gift of great cooking!!

So happy we found this place. It's off Sahara behind the Jack in the Box, so it was a little tricky to find but well worth it. My gf and I both got the fish and shrimp tacos. The service was great and the food tasted delicious, homemade and very fresh. We will return as the menu is big and I want to try everything!

Best Mexican food I've come across and I don't give that type of compliment easy.  
My cousin said his horchata was the best he's ever had.  
Fresh made tortilla chips, street tacos were great.  Fish taco and shrimp taco were A+.
Hell even the lemons were the best I've had(no seeds and fresh)

Seriously nothing to even complain the slightest about

Super nice lady for our waitress and made us feel at home.  

Highly recommended and once you go once you'll be coming back.

Great authentic Mexican food the way my grandpa used to make at his restaurant when I was a kid!! Our family ate a little of everything. The fajitas were flavorful and soft. I had the quesadilla with carne Asada ... YUM. It was HUGE on their homemade corn tortillas!! I couldn't finish it. Our daughter had some chicken flautas and my husband had the Huarache Azteca with carne asada and nopalitos . I was so full I didn't have any room for their arroz con leche but that's what I would have had for dessert. Delicious and reasonably priced. Worth the drive off the strip for this food!!
We love Chef Alberto! We hope he has great success. The food was scrumptious and he was  welcoming and delightful. We'll definitely be back.

Cue the meat sweats- this place has the biggest torta I've ever seen, stacked with five different meats! The Cubana Mexicana has pork leg, ham, egg, hotdog, breaded steak, Mexican sausage, and cheese. Along with lettuce, tomato, and I'm pretty sure I tasted some avocado in there. This thing literally feeds four, and I barely put a dent in my quarter.

But you probably came here for more typical Mexican eats!
The fish taco ($3.50) and shrimp taco ($4) are both good deals with a good amount of protein, but the batter was thicker than I'd like. Stick to the seafood tacos though, as the carne asada was pretty average.

The ceviches are alright- the price range is a bit different from other places I frequent and my usual $5-8 tostada mixta is $11 here so I have yet to shell out the scratch to see how it compares. The fish is fresh though and the portions are fairly standard.

Menu is huge, with burritos, fajitas, breakfast, and even soups that I haven't yet tried. Even the drink menu has a ridiculous number of options, including beer, wine, smoothies, juices, aguas frescas, and milkshakes. They should have a bingo card for diners to make their way through various sections of the menu, and a wall of fame/shame for anyone who can dominate that massive torta.

This was our 1st time here & it was excellent.  We ordered  shrimp tostada, fish taco,  carne asada taco,  shrimp meal, & two agua frescas. The piña agua was delicious, the tostada, and handmade tortillas too. Overall very good,  highly recommended, we'll definitely return.
Encontré este lugar de casualidad, Fish tacos,huarache azteca deliciosos y de muy buen tamaño...y que decir del cóctel  "vuelve a la vida" excelente!!!

We went in at 7 on a Sunday night. I had really high hopes for the food. The food was okay, my fish tacos had sour cream on it- WEIRD. Fine but they forgot about my aunt's food so she pretty much had to sit there and watch us eat. The salsa was bland but the chips were good. Just an OK place to eat, but don't go in if you're starving!

I've never dined in, but I ordered takeout from here the other day. And OMG the shrimp tacos were amazing! Probably the best I've ever had. I also ordered a small bowl of Pozole, which was also very flavorful. I can't wait to try more items on their menu.
Great food, very clean and great service, Mojarra was perfect, I recommend this place to anyone who loves Mexican food

So we are in Las Vegas and I spot this out of the way place hmmmmm let's try I'm starved, well ok probably the best fajitas I've had, and I've had lots:) my husband loved his as well (bistec ala mexicana) had to try yelp! So good!

AWSOME !! My wife had the camaron a la diabla we sugest you have the mild it down because the hot truely comes from hell. I had the torta cubana it was GREAT  man vs food size portion too.... Next time in Vegas we will definitely come again.

I'm a bit confused by all these reviews. Hubby and I couldn't wait to try this place due to the reviews. We ordered the largest seafood cocktail they had. $19!! It had 5 shrimp and a nice half of avocado on top but as my husband was fishing for all the stuff I won't eat (octopus and squid) he was greatly disappointed. I had to laugh at the teeny tiny piece of octopus he finally found in this large glass of cocktail. Next, I ordered the empanadas and he ordered the pambazo sandwich. My empanadas came and it was just one on a large plate and it's not what you have ever had before. Basically it was a large fried taco. They served it open and stuffed it full of lettuce. No sides come with it. Just this fried taco. The sandwich my husband ordered was more like a small breakfast sandwich missing an egg. The horchata was pretty delicious tho. The place was empty but clean. The waitress was sweet. Overall, the food seemed fresh but underwhelming. Nothing special.
Very good food. Atmosphere is nice. Feels like a family run business. Good service. Good food. So glad we yelped and tried it out. Will return when in Las Vegas again.

My husband and I had some time to kill after dropping our car off at Toyota. I wanted breakfast but wasn't in the mood for Denny's. I searched the area and this restaurant came out on top of yelp. The restaurant is hidden within a strip mall Sahara & Decatur Northeast side. It was a little hard to find inside the lot. The place is huge and they weren't busy which was good for us. Our waitress was excellent. Orange juice is fresh squeezed and was wonderful. We ordered breakfast burritos and my husband doesn't eat pork. The waitress was happy to substitute Chicken breast at no extra cost.  The burrito was with green sauce and was wonderful. It had a slightly citrus flavor.  I don't live in the area but will definitely come back. I hope they can do some advertising to get some traffic over there.

Great selection, great prices and great service.  Was in there over Memorial Day weekend and the service was great. We ordered tacos, enchiladas and fajitas.  All were tasty.  Prices were very reasonable too.  Would definitely recommend.

Had a wonderful time at Playa Papagayos! We were a group of 20 and our server Mayra had wonderful customer service. Super patient and attentive. If you are ever in Vegas make time to come in. They food was also delicious.

This place is near my work and my sister wanted to try so we stopped by for dinner. They were pretty slow when we came in, they had one table which left when we came in then we were the only ones there throughout the entire dinner. 

Super friendly staff, they explained the menu to us, made recommendations and took good care of us throughout the meal. The chef even came out and checked on us. 

Food was really good! The complimentary salsa was delicious, has a little kick to it which I like, chips were fresh and crunchy. We got the soup which was HUGE, the three of us shared and still had left overs. The soup was so good, so flavorful but not too salty, I was full but kept eating more soup because I did not want to stop. The gigantic cubano was...a lot! Definitely recommend sharing, no one should ever eat that much meat in one sitting :) But flavor wise it was bomb! The combination of meats with the egg and veggies just worked. We also got oysters, which were fresh and tasted as expected. We got somethin else but I forgot what it was...

Overall really enjoyed the food here. Not a fancy place or anything but had very friendly service and excellent quality food.
The best Authentic Mexican food in town.  Every plate taste as if your Mexican mom cooked it.  Truely amazing good eats

The reviews don't lie! The food is definitely delicious! They had me with the taste like homemade chips and salsa. I had the shrimp tacos which tasted so fresh and so yummy! I def will be back!! It's on Sahara and Decatur by the jack in the box.

One of the best milanesa tortas I've had. The ingredients tasted fresh and the bread was buttered on both sides. The staff is super friendly and very welcoming. I'm so glad I decided to try this place after one year. I was hesitant because it never seemed busy but it's only because they're hidden and hard to find. You'll love it! I'm definitely making this my regular go to spot

This Place is a must!!  The Cuban Torta was the best Torta I have ever had.  Make sure to ask to taste all the salsa's including the diabla sauce.  Papagayos has made a bold statement with their signature Salsa's. Gorditas are also great!!  Stay away from basic breakfast buros because there is just to many five star creations on the menu to waste time with the basics.  The secret will be out soon so get in while you can.  the service and beer selection was very good.  Our server who was from Riverside was on point offering detailed descriptions of presentations and flavors.

An assortment of unique recipes will certainly provide choices to please every palate.  Special recognition for meals cooked to order with quality ingredients. The plethora of aromas emanating from the kitchen leaves no doubt! The cocina autentica combined with Música Latina round-out the experience! Buen Apetito!

It has everything you look for in a 5 star rating restaurant. Very clean, excellent service and amazing food !  Food was served quickly. Ordered an agua Fresca and the waitress made it there on the spot. Deliciously fresh food  definitely spreading the word

service was great, but my shrimp cocktail was horrible! :( Shrimp had no flavor it was like shrimp in ketchup, worst iver ever had, but then my boyfriends got an order of shrimp tostadas and caldo de 7 mares and they were both good. Maybe they just had a bad batch of shrimp cocktail but i doubt it but will never be ordering it again.

We searched all sites for best "street" tacos wanting really good Mexican food...the search is over!  Came in on Friday for late lunch and had to come back for breakfast the next day! Torta Milanese, Chile Verde Chimi, Fish Tacos and Chilaquiles met and exceeded our expectations and the desire to have a place to call ours for really great food! Also, the service was beyond great - we felt like family! We will come back to visit our new friends and to continue our journey around the menu!
Best Mexican food in the area. Good value and very friendly wait staff.

The location is hidden from the Main Street but if you find it you're in luck!! Two thumbs up on their tacos and they have really good salsa. I tried a bit of their steak dish which was also good. Not expensive at all.... must try for yourself.

Authentic and so very very tasty. My daughter doesn't eat anything and she SO approved of the food. Chimichanga was like a surprise in every bite the way it was stuffed full of goodness and perfectly fried. All salsas were packed with flavor and enchilada sauce was amazing. It's been a long time since we've found a good red sauce on enchiladas and this was it

Delicious food, good service, and just off the beaten path.  LOVED this place.  The tacos are authentic and well priced.  
My favorite tacos are in Tijuana, especially their octopus tacos (they're amazing, highly recommended you add it to your bucket list).  It was a little slower and I noticed octopus as an option on the menu.  I asked if the chef could make some octopus tacos special.  He said he could and they were exactly as I wanted.  So good!  Can't wait to go back.
My boyfriend and I love this place. He lives in Colorado and I live in California and we meet in the middle to eat here. The food is delicious and even more importantly, the service is wonderful!
Authentic Mexican food served with a smile. Made to order, fantastic taste, accommodating for special orders. A great find in Vegas!

This place is great!  My kids loved their milkshakes, and I really liked the hibiscus drink.  My husband tried to eat all of the torta... He said it was soooo good but it filled him up :).  We really liked all of the homemade tortillas, and we'll be back!  Waitstaff was delightful.

For the first time yelp let me down based on what we had for lunch . I ordered a Cuban torta and I couldn't even finish it . I guess the reviews are more based of there seafood dishes . Service was good but that's about it .

I hadn't tasted Mexican food like this since I grew up in a small town in SE Arizona. I recommend this place in the area over anything I've ever had. Their quesadillas and empanadas are the best of the list. The service is phenomenal and the cook personally asked us how our experience was. Please spread the word on this place because I pray they stick around. They have a salad that is very very hot and you won't be discouraged to try it.

Absolutely fabulous Mexican food with tons of fish and shrimp options. Lots of more unique foods that are not on many other menus, which was a really nice change of pace. Try the agua fresca (We got limon and melon), it's great! We cant wait to return and try more things! For our first visit, I tried the filet de pescado in garlic and butter and it was so tender and flavorful! Our waitresses were both so helpful and friendly and gave us just the right amount of attention and advice.

My friend and wanted to try something new close to work. We came here and boy did we maker a good choice! The food and service was great! We both ordered Pambazo sandwich, it's dipped in enchilada sauce with chorizo, lettuce, sour cream, and potatoes. We both split the sandwich but after eating it.  We wished we would've gotta a full sandwich.  The sandwich was delicious! We both ordered a sopa  chicken and carne asada. The sopas were as big as the plate it came out on. It came with beans, lettuce , cheese, and the meat. We couldn't finish the sopa. I'll definitely be back again to try another dish.
Very good ceviche and one of the better chicken moles I've had in Las Vegas.  My husband loved his bistec and the homemade corn tortillas.  Nice family frel, very clean.
I just found my new mariscos spot! This place is so good and everything is made fresh and the prices are reasonable. Don't let the location fool you, it's kinda hidden away in a strip mall.

It's portrayed as a seafood restaurant but the truth is that the seafood menu is fairly basic, we ordered a shrimp cocktail and it was ok, but far from being amazing. I had a torta Cubana and it was really good, very authentic, not to mention it's big enough to easily feed two people. The aguas frescas are remarkably good, probably the best I've had in town. If you want traditional Mexican food in general this place is very good, but if you're specifically looking for Mexican style seafood, you might find their selection a little limited.
Great hiddden gem only a few minutes off the strip. Try the camarones de diabla, it's so good and spicy! The sandwich cubano was huge and delicious!

We were extremely hopeful of this place, based on the reviews, however it didn't live up to its expectations.  The prepared oysters looked great, but lacked flavor. 

The "Vuelve a La Vida" cocktail was more tomato juice than anything else. We found one oyster, with hardly little bits of octopus and crab. When we asked about the flavor, the manager and also chef came out to talk to us. He was originally reluctant to take the plate back but when we showed him the soupy cocktail and missing shrimp he claimed the shrimp was being cooked and would be added as a side dish. We ended up sending the plate back and while he apologized he insisted they never accept the return of the plate because it's seafood. Nonetheless our plate was half assed and lacked flavor. Not coming back.

Food seems real good but service needs a little help. The server was really nice and tried hard, he was just a little nervous and not trained well. The manager seemed nice and came out to make sure all was well so in the end I decided to give more stars and will come back.

Problems:
-Had to ask for a menu and where to sit.
-Had to ask for a straw.
-Had to ask for napkins. 
-Had to ask for a refill but I never got it until asking.
-Brought my check but no refill even though I said when I first ordered I'm keeping the menu and ordering more. 
-Had to ask for more chips while I waited for my second two tacos. 

But the food was so good I put up with the service and ordered two more tacos and tipped $5 on a $13 bill. Haha.

I'll be back and update later I'm sure.
They were extremely busy but the service and food was awesome still.  The chef and server worked together to make sure everyone was happy.   We would def come back when in Las Vegas!

Not too far off the strip, the restaurant was quiet and we found out they had been there less than a year. The waitress was very attentive, and the handmade tortillas were great.  My husband and I weren't terribly hungry so we split the fajitas. It was a generous plate, more so than other Mexican restaurants I've been to, and we had to take the rest to go. The menu had many choices, and the beer was real cold. Super yummy. I'd recommend. Way better in price, value, and taste than the cattle buffets in the strip casinos. Thanks Yelp, I was not disappointed with the restaurant: true to its good reviews.
Shrimp tacos were average. Nothing to get too excited about. Huarachas were thick tortillas with hot sauce and meat. Came because of the 4.5 stars but didnt find anything to rate that way.

I was in the area and decided to find some place to eat. Went on Yelp. Saw amazing reviews of this place and decided to give it a try. Mostly for my husband who is searching for the best fish tacos everywhere we go. He used to live in San Diego and he is searching for that type of tacos that he ate there. As for me I've never been a taco fan. 
So I came in, and chose a table near electricity outlet to charge my phone. Salsa and cheeps came out immediately. And they were the best I've had. Both homemade and super fresh. Then I ordered fish tacos - One breaded and one not (just grilled). People! I'm serious, I'm addicted now! A ate two of them, and I'm so full. I can hardly breathe. But they so worth it. The customer service is amazing,  everybody smiling and greeting me very politely, especially the lady who served me. And the young boy. I Feel like superstar the whole time. Light Mexican music on the background is a nice bonus. I feel like I'm in Mexico  Yes. I'm still here writing this review. Cause I'm so happy right now, that I couldn't leave it for later. I'm going to order one more set of tacos and their famous Torta Cubana to go for my husband. I hope he'll like it. And I hope I finally found his best fish taco place :)
The food here is amazing!!! The torta Cubana was wonderful! The service is excellent. The owner is the chef and he came out and talked to us about his food! What a great place! You have to eat here!

I have lived in this area for a very long time and I have to say I was happy to know a great mexican restaurant and now in pmour neighborhood. I ate the pozole and it was bomb. Will definitely be coming back for more

Place is clean, employees very friendly, my bf and I ordered the Cuban sandwich it was huuuuggee, perfect for sharing and also got a chorizo sope which was a huge portion as well! Owner came out to the tables and made sure everything was ok, he was very friendly

Absolutely amazing Mexican food and people. Cleaner than I expected. I would highly recommend this restaurant, if your looking for a casual place. I swear I do not know anyone hear in this place just stumbled on it.
Excellent service from our waitress and chef. Relaxing environment. Salsa was spicy and refreshing.
Very very good Mexican food! The torta  Cubana and pambazo where great! Also got a campechana the mix was very fresh. They have real homemade horchata (delicious) and real blended fruit drinks..
Home town restaurant .   Local hang out.  Great authentic Mexico Mexican food.   Nothing fancy, great food !!!
Saw this place on Yelp and it was close to my house , just had the Torta Cubana and it was delicious. Will def have it again.

My family and I were in town looking for a good authentic Mexican restaurant off the strip.  We found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try. The place is clean and the waitress, whom I didn't get her name, was really nice. It was a slow night but the food didn't disappoint. I had the asada huarache and it was delicious. My husband ordered the torta de milanesa and he really liked it. At the end of our meal the owner came out and greeted us and asked how the food was. He was really down to earth and invited us to come back. I really appreciated the great service and it was really reasonably priced.

Que rico!!

This restaurant is tucked away on a strip mall on West Sahara and Decatur behind Jack-in-the-box. I love that they have outdoor seatings and the indoors have window from one end to the other end making it well lit. I felt like I was in Mexico and they were playing Mexican music videos.

Very clean place, opened a year and a half ago. Not your normal American seafood joint. This is a Mexican style place that serves fresh seafood and authentic dishes  plus beer and cocktails.

We had -
Tostada Super Mixta
Patillos De Cena Mojarra Frita (Fried Tilapia)
Chile Colorado

For drinks- 
Cerveza Chab mex
Margarita Cuervo

The chef/owner came out to make sure everything is good. Elsa, our waitress is attentive.

This was our first visit today and certainly won't be our last!
Had lunch here today.  Loved it!  It really felt like I was in Mexico.  My fish taco was by far the best I've had in this town.  Can't wait to go back and try more items!

I recently moved into a new neighborhood. 
Of course I will search around for places to eat and places to dine.  Here I found some nice eats.
Start by saying people in this business work so hard as I know 1st hand and it's the toughest business imaginable for so many reasons. 
That said they are in a tough location as well.
About the food it's nice homemade Mexican and takes the appropriate amount of time to be cooked to order. They have a huge juicer and make juice drinks fresh to order and they will mix  a variety for you if you ask.
I like to help places like this and give them a shot and my support.
The landlords will do anything to get these people to sign a lease in a dead rundown type center but once they are in they are on their own.
I ate here a few times already.
Lots more to try in the future.
Go by and support these non chain mom and pops if you can because it takes everything they have to keep it going and in some cases they turn around and can be a success story that you helped with.
Food was delicious!  I got a burrito it was so flavorful.  The salsa is good too!  My friend got chorizo and eggs and she literally almost licked the plate.  The staff is super friendly too!

Playa Papagayos is housed in a large strip mall on Decatur and Sahara.  The place is clean and wait staff pleasant.  The place looks like an old 6s diner with the checkerboard floors.  Service was quick.  Even though we went at an odd hour 3:30pm, there were a few diners enjoying their meals.  We settled on the Torta Milanese and a Gordita pollo.  Hubby finished his Torta enjoying every bite.  His only issue is that the Torta could have been bigger.   I spiced up my gordita with hot sauce and salsa.  Perfect.  A gordita is two fried tortilla shells with lettuce, Mexican cheese and meat of your choice.  Delish!
Water glasses were filled promptly.  Great prices too.

OMG the ceviche was outstanding. Glad the waitress warned about how hot the hot sauce was. The beef in our tacos was very flavorful. 
The menu is in Spanish with English subtitles. The chef made our meal to order and was worth the wait. 
We will return as it's the real deal.

This was our first visit and certainly won't be our last! We ordered the fish tacos (without sour cream) and an Aztec Huarache (steak & nopales). I also ordered the agua fresca de fresa (strawberry). Everything was fresh and delicious! We hadn't had good fish tacos since living in CA. I'm typically not a fan of nopales (cactus) but I decided to try them as part of the Aztec Huarache and they were so good I found myself eating them off the Huarache! 
The restaurant is very clean and the staff were kind and welcoming, like you were coming over to eat at friend's house. We will be coming back to try more of their extensive menu! ...we did order an additional shrimp taco -not pictured because it just went down too quickly to be photographed!

Mexican style seafood is a favorite, and they did good job, had the "return to life" ceviche, the 7 Mares stew and a limon fresca, my friend had the Torta Cubana and horchata.  Everything was big and tasty, could not eat all the food.  The drinks were great in size and taste.
It's a hidden Mexican marsiscos place. Flavor is outstanding. Even writing this review is making want to there right now. I order the fajitas with beef, chicken, and shrimp. They were amazing.

We're sort of new to Vegas and have been looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant for quite a while now, with no luck. This place opened in November/2016 and it's kind of hidden but I'm so glad I found it! It's so freaking delicious! The service was wonderful. There were two girls checking on us and serving us, very genuinely friendly. Everything looked good so we took a little long to make up our minds. We finally ordered the torta cubana, plato de bistec, 3 tacos de asada, two shrimp tacos, 3 glass bottles of coke and an order of Menudo to go, it all came out to less than $60. May I add, their tortillas are hand made! That to me is a bonus. Their tortilla chips were fresh as well. We didn't wait long for our food either. I've always said I don't care for the price as long as the food is worth it and this food was just that and more! We're definitely coming back for breakfast tomorrow!

What a great surprise to find out that this location is owned by the same family that owns the Playa Papagayos I have eaten at many, many times in San Bernardino, CA going back way into the early 1990's and also their location in Colton, CA.  The food was just as I remembered it, flavorful and very satisfying.  

I had the Azteca huarache and my boyfriend had the menudo that came with freshly made corn tortillas.  Both tasted just as I remembered!  I highly recommend giving any of their locations a try.  Their menu offers a large variety of food and anything you pick will leave you wanting to come back for more!

The owner takes great pride in the food he personally prepares and is honestly one of the nicest guys around.  Give this place a try!  You won't be disappointed!

Extremely authentic Mexican joint with a heavy emphasis on fresh seafood hidden in the corner of a shopping center off the beaten path in Vegas. 

The gang were all very happy with their surprisingly reasonably priced meals...fish tacos, fried shrimp tacos, shrimp ceviche served in a martini glass with a nice hunk of avocado on top, plain quesadilla, and they even made us bean and rice tacos which were not on the menu. Very accommodating! 

We paired our delicious food which was served to us remarkably quickly by our kind Spanish speaking waiter and waitress with refreshing coconut pineapple and mango frescos. They hit the spot on a typical hot afternoon in Nevada.

We were the only ones in entire the place at lunchtime, but that was no indication of the quality and taste of the food. This newer restaurant is large and can fit quite a bit of people. They're going to need the space....It's pretty darn delicious here! 

If you're visiting Vegas and have a car, this joint is worth going out of your way for! 

*Restrooms are located just outside in the hallway.

Food is authentic and taste amazing. I tried a pambazo and a Gordita and they tasted home made, I will come back and try more things they have so much options! Reason I took off one star is because they took 30-45 min to bring our food out and there was only 2 tables so it wasn't busy for it to take so long but if you can deal with waiting them it's worth it.

I loved this place from the first visit. The service was A1 on point. I felt like I was walking into my aunt's house. Everyone was very friendly and warm.
The agua de amaica was delicious and perfectly tart and sweet. Normally jamaica you find tastes like grape juice and water so this was welcome!
The chips they bring out are fresh made along with the different salsas they give you. The shrimp diablados are spicy as hell, believe them when they tell you this. Get homemade tortillas, sit back, and unbutton your jeans. 
Nice substantial portions and just plain good homestyle Mexican food. I didn't get a chance to try their mariscos but I will be back soon.

Totally agree with most reviews on this place! Very/super close to authentic Mexican food, besides my mom's cooking lol I tried their huarache and it exceeded my expectations, super good! Great and fast service! My friends got the Cuban sandwich and chimichanga and they loved it. I need to go back and try more of their food. (It's so hard to be on a diet) :(

The great reviews are well deserved. The food is great!
The Cubana Mexicana sandwich is BOMB! I do not like hot dogs so I subbed them for avocado and it was everything I expected and more! I had it for lunch and dinner, and was left full both times.
I also enjoyed the Pozole. My first time trying this soup and it was delicious. I like that it's a little sour and hearty at the same time. Really good!
The Gordita was a first time try for me as well. It speaks to me because I'm a gordita at heart :) It was soooo good! Fluffy tortilla with chicken (comes with your choice of meat), and cheese. 
The fresca's are supersized and mixed to order. 
The restaurant is super clean and the ladies behind the register are sweet. Chef really does his thang, the food reflects the time he takes to prepare it.
The menu has a variety of sea food dishes that I look forward to trying. There is so much to come back for!

Arrived around 6pm and we were the only one here.  We had a choice of sitting anywhere.  We are always at an odd number with the 5 of us.  The four seaters are always too cram and we always feel guilty in 8 seaters  when there aren't any 6 seaters.  We opted for the 8 seater, since we had the whole place to ourselves. 

Chips and salsa came quick and was ok. 3 stars

I ordered the Mojarra and the way it came out was cooked perfectly.  Most places either over cook them or do a poor job cleaning them.  Not here, my fish was cleaned well with the stomach taken out.  Based on the color of the fried skin you can tell the fryer had very clean or new oil and tasted amazing. 5 stars

My daughter had the Posale enjoyed it as she said she was full, but kept eating.  I meat was falling off the bone just like it should. 5 stars

4 carne asada tacos for the two little ones.  3 stars

Wife ordered the pork skin Gordita. When it came out, it was not what my wife expected as she thought the skin would have been crunchy, but still tasted great. 4 stars.

A little out of our way, but a definite return for the posole and the Mojarra.  When we left the lady said next time ask for garlic butter to be spread on it.  WTH! Why didnt she mentioned that when I ordered.  Still a nice experience.
Kind of hidden away in a quiet shopping center, the seafood is great, fish tacos are a must!

Playa Papagayos has only been open for two weeks. I seen a sign on the corner of Decatur and Sahara the night before so I pulled into the shopping center and went inside to grab a menu. 

I then called this morning for a to-go order.

I ordered their shredded beef Huaracha, which was one of the best thing I ate in a long time. The beef had a good Smoky taste to it. The Huaracha crispy and full of flavor. I also ordered their gordita with carne asada it was also really good. I ordered their Pambazo I ever had anything like it before. Their fish taco was good the fish was beer battered fried. My Wife had ordered the shrimp cocktail my daughter ordered the wet burrito with chicken she said that she would eat that every day if she could.

I spoke to the owner and chef Alberto he explained to me about his style comes from Mexico city and southern Mexico and it's more authentic with better flavor. 

I will be coming back to try their seafood.

First of all if this was truly a five star restaurant why was it empty at lunchtime today?  Hmmm.................I ordered Heurache Carne Asada.............the meat was WAY overcooked and dry like shoe leather.
Our chicken, shrimp and carne asada fajitas were delicious. Service was excellent. Beer was ice cold. Nice selection of Mexican beers.

Tried this place out last night and it was the best!! We got the carne asada tacos,  fish tacos and fish ceviche tostada and they were all fantastic! The service was on point and the chef (owner?) even delivered some of our food and you could tell he took pride in his work. Love that! So glad we found this place and will definitely be returning!

The food looked delicious, the place was clean and service very good. I took about 16 people here for lunch and most everyone was happy. Unfortunately it is in a dying strip mall, hard to find by some. My chili verde burrito was so salty I could not eat it but my fish taco was delicious with large chunks of fish (I had the unbreaded kind). My hubby had the Cubano Mexican sandwich which was so large he could only eat half of it. Overall the other lunches looked great and I got a lot of positive comments from the group. Many will go back.

Hands down one of the best torta spots here in Vegas straight from Mexico City! The bread is good and doesn't crumble like most. Everything is fresh and the shakes and fresh waters are amazing. Definitely coming back to try more food! The place is also very clean and organized. Really good!!!!!
Been there twice the food was delicious both times they have fruit drinks there the bomb it's like a Mom & Pop restaurant can't go wrong there I highly recommend
First time there, had the Torta Cubana, was delicious. Excellent service, will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

This place has such a welcoming family feel to it.  I absolutely love the ceviche except that it's cooked in lemon instead of lime. This place offers cooked shrimp prior.  My preference is shrimp cooked for the acidity from lemon but it can be overbearing

This place is the closest to authentic Mexican food on the west side & I am so glad it's right down the street from my work.

Food was awesome. He got the Pambazo and I got two tacos - one grilled fish and one grilled shrimp. Everything was delicious but the grilled shrimp taco stood out. Aguas Frescas were cold and refreshing. The guanabana was amazing. My only regret is that we didn't get the large. I might have to go back for another tomorrow. 

The flan is nothing like any flan I've tasted before. It's more the texture of cheesecake but very light. Yum.

A special spot! Tried the torta Cubana per reviews and the waitress's suggestion. Not disappointed! Very delicious, spacious, clean and the cook was friendly when I walked in the door while the waitress was occupied. Not to mention delicious fresh salsa!!

This place is a true hidden gem! Despite its odd location in a strip mall, the food is the moat authentic Mexican I have had outside of Mexico. My husband got the pambazo sandwich and I got the shrimp tacos and Ceviche torta. Everything was amazing! The people who work there are super nice too. The chef even came out and talked to us. We will definitely be back!
The best Mexican food I've had in Vegas! Way better than anywhere on the strip or downtown.  Highly recommend.  Everything is super fresh, and really inexpensive.
Delicious food. Everyone very nice. I will be returning and recommend this place. Menu has tons of options. Yummy.

i'm from mexico city and for as long as i've lived in vegas i have searched for a good, authentic, mexican restaurant. i came across playa papagayos today and fell in love with the food and the people. the food was delicious and the customer service was amazing. 10/10 would recommend- if you haven't tried playa papagayos you are missing out!
If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, you found it. Delicious food and great customer service.

Such hidden gem this place is! I'm so glad my fiance and I went out to dine here. Not only was all of our food freshly made and delicious,  but every single one of the employees was very kind. We are glad we came across this place, we will defiantly be coming back.

Recently fortunate enough to have dined at many of Mexico City's best, a chance to visit the coastal noma residency passed up to instead explore restaurants both high-brow and literally 'hole in the wall' that have helped make the Mexican Capital a dining destination for everything from Tripe Tacos and Ant Larvae to Foie Gras and Wagyu Beef, it was with a bit of hesitancy that the decision was made to visit Playa Papagayos Restaurant on Friday afternoon, the experience thankfully proving to be a good one by any standard with gracious service and some truly delicious cuisine.

Open now since November in a shopping plaza at the corner of Decatur and Sahara, not exactly a culinary 'hot-spot' with the Fantastik Indoor Swapmeet only a few steps away, Playa Papagayo translates literally to Parrot Beach and although nothing about the sizable space tucked beside a Pizza parlor screams tropical, the restaurant is clean and well lit with a lot of seating, a petit Mexican woman greeting diners at the door and offering them a wide range of tables with padded chairs, many of them coated in clear plastic.

Playing traditional Latin American music overhead and Soccer on a pair of Televisions, the clientele sparse but consisting mostly of local businessmen and a few Mexican women who seemed to be doing work as they partook in Salads, large Sandwiches or Soups, it was with water in hand that the sizable menu from Chef Alberto Ocampo was perused, one at the table opting for a $2.50 Aguas Fresca that quickly saw the lone-server turn craftsman, a mix of fresh Fruit, Sugar and bottled Water placed in a Vitamix with the result a creamy concoction that was only slightly sweet and whole lot better than the typical lunchtime Iced Tea or Soda.

Ranging from typical Tacos and Burritos to more esoteric regional specialties from the state of Guerrero, the original home of Chef Ocampo before relocating and opening his first restaurant in Colton California, first-time diners at Playa Papagayo would be well-advised to approach the menu front-to-back with the first two pages focusing on lighter bites such as the Oysters, Shrimp, Fish and Octopus that put the original location on the map, the $6 Camaron Tostada featuring plump little Shrimp with plenty of Citrus amidst the flavor of chopped Onions and Cilantro, the portion quite large for the price-point, especially when accounting for the big slice of fresh Avocado.

Reportedly importing many of the Spices and Meats from the family's home town, a Chicken Mole and housemade Huaraches more than enough reason to return, it was after a short wait spent watching two Chefs work that three plates were brought forth along with two Salsas, one look at the Cubana Mexicana Torta enough to make even the hungriest diner question their capacity, the soft Roll stretched to its limits around five types of Meat, two styles of Cheese plus Vegetables and a light Sauce, the flavor of the Breaded Steak and Pork Sausage most prevalent amongst the mix with the wise only enjoying half, making for essentially two full meals for just eleven bucks.

Not particularly a 'diet-friendly' place, though healthful choices can certainly be made by way of Tuna or Shrimp Salad, Seafood Soup or the raw Shellfish noted above, those taking a more all-in approach are encouraged to next take a look at the regionally famous fork-and-knife Pambazo, a housemade Roll dipped in mild red Sauce and fried in a pan with Potatoes and Pork Sausage, the addition of sliced Lettuce and Fresh Cheese adding just enough levity to keep things fresh, as also was the case with the thick Cornmeal Gordita opened up and stuffed with crispy fried Pig Skin.
 
Unfortunately sold out of the Rice Pudding, but still offering three additional Desserts including a daily Gelatin plus a Fruit Parfait sold in two sizes, those looking for something truly unique would be wise to invest $2.95 in the Flan Napolitano, a small wedge of the Cheese Custard served more like a soft Cake than the traditional creamy pudding, a style not seen to this point and explained by the Chef as 'a family secret' when he later walked around the room asking diners how they had enjoyed their experience.

**** Perhaps even more varied than the numerous styles of cuisine found in China or India it would be difficult to name the perfect 'Mexican' restaurant, but in terms of dollar-for-dollar value in terms of taste, quality and execution one would be hard-pressed to name spot in Las Vegas outperforming Playa Papagayos in terms of its style, the majority of the food probably a little heavy for some but undoubtedly made fresh from good ingredients and with a lot of thought.
Great food,  great taste.  Authentic Mexican flavors,  I totally recomend this place.

Simply delicious!
Food was so fresh, fun - happy music, clean and inviting atmosphere but most of all; excellent service (good job Hizella)!! 

Good service is such a rarity these days. 
We will be coming back!!!

Wow this place was such a pleasant surprise. I was at the swap meet and read some good stuff about this place so decided to walk down to check it out. 
I had the menudo and let me tell you that in San Francisco nowhere has menudo 7 days a week. It's usually a weekend thing so I was so happy to see it offered. It was so delicious and if I'm back in the area I'll definitely come back. 
Also the waitress was such a sweet heart.

I was driving down Sahara crossing Decatur and thought, I'm hungry. I did a Yelp and I saw this restaurant and it had 5 stars...I'm there! It's in a huge shopping complex and can be seen off Sahara, so worth it. It's not a place you're going to for a love rendezvous or 1st date... it's big, bright and casual. It has everything, the menu lacks nothing .... breakfast, menudo, posole, tortes anytime. I had the machacha and it was excellent! They brought some red chile that had a great spicy bite to it. I saw fish, ceviche, octopus and more. Oh yeah, their corn tortillas handmade. The service is great and friendly. They have Agua Fresca, milk shakes, beers and margaritas

Great menu with delicious food at a reasonable price. 
We were a party of nine, and absolutely everyone was pleased with their dinner. 
We will be back. 
(I just wish this place was closer to home. )

This is the spot I come when in town with Auntie - had the chance to bring Coach and hands downs some good food! Not only is the food delicious, food is made with love! Food is flavorful, fresh, large portions, smells amazing and the bomb...........family owned stop by and grub!
Uffffff  que pambazo tan más delicioso! Toda la comido estuvo muy rica. Voy a estar llendo muy seguido.
Had the oysters and the mixed cerveche and the mango margarita.  Everything was fresh reasonably priced and good.
The best mexican manudo its here and the torta cubana woww great service. Great people . The michelaas so good.

If i can give 6 stars I will,
The best tortas In The whole wide world,
As a torta eater, I can tell you that your mouth hasn't taste anything like it, Cuban Torta is a breakfast, lunch and diner, and will ask for a to go container,
So, make sure you bring a toper ware, 
On, 4/7 Chef Alberto has put together  two amazing tortas that will remember my entire life, prices are acorde, attention to detail is always never ending, great ambiance and customer service which is hard to find.
One thing, tortas only last till it's finished, which is ok, Cs I can eat those tortas cubanas the whole entire day.
Decatur/Sahara behind the Jack in the box, #20 can't miss it, THE BEST TORTAS IN TOWN....!!

The food was fresh and delicious. The staff was very friendly and made some awesome suggestions. I had the fish sandwich, it was hand breaded in house. So tasty! My husband said that he enjoyed the menudo and it was some of the best he had ever had.
Nice casual family restaurant. Had chicken soft taco & shredded beef taco. Both excellent. Hubby enjoyed their enchilada & taco with very good rice & beans.

Only bad thing about this place is trying to find it: it is directly behind Jack in the box, or Sees candy.  Went for the fish tacos, service was great, waitress explained items on the menu, came back to ask if sauces were ok, too hot, ok?  Very attentive. When I looked around a second for the waitress, cook promptly came out and asked how he could help.  Got a pazole to go for a friend: he said pazole is excellent. Will be back for tacos.
Very good . Had this place the other day for the first time and was very happy and enjoyed every bit. I live near and will be here more often
Found this place just messing around on yelp came to try it and everybody is right staff is great the cubana the bomb i dont know how long this place has been open but glad to find it

Came here on cinco de mayo and forgot to leave a review, after driving around Sunday night like crazy people we came across playa papagayos on yelp and decided to stop by. We instantly loved making this choice we tried a lil bit of everything and even though they were about to close they decided to still serve us and did a great job! Im actually in vegas today and will stop by tomorrow again before leaving!!! 6 stars if i could.....

The food at Playa Papagayos is excellent! Real authentic Mexican food made with all fresh ingredients...they even make their own home made tortillas too. The best Mexican food I have ever had in Las Vegas! The Pollo mole is my favorite and it is so delicious! Surely I will eat here again!
